greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binary XOR of divisors of n.
comment: If 2^k <= n < 2^(k+1), then also 2^k <= a(n) < 2^(k+1), since any proper divisor of n is < 2^k.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8191
program: a178910 = foldl1 xor . a027750_row :: Integer -> Integer
xref: Cf. A027750, A072594; subsequences A028982 (odd), A028982 (even).
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 22 2010
